qas.question: What did the British fear could provide guidance to the German air force?
What part of the military did many people working for the BBC end up serving in?
What was the final thing shown on the BBC before it was shut down for the war?
When did most people mistakenly remember the last broadcast as having ended?

answers.text: before the end of the cartoon

qas.question: What day did Britain declare war on Germany?
What year was Mickey's Gala Premier written?

plausible_answers.text: VHF transmissions would act as a beacon to enemy aircraft homing in on London.

qas.question: What was the station concerned about with regard to VHF transmissions?
What were many of the television service's technical radar staff needed for in the war effort?

context: On <b4_0>1 September 1939<b4_0/>, two days before Britain declared war on Germany, the station was taken off air with little warning; the government was concerned that the <a0_0><b6_0>VHF transmissions<a0_0/> would act as a beacon to enemy aircraft homing in on London.<b6_0/> Also, many of the television service's technical staff and <b7_0>engineers<b7_0/> would be needed for the war effort, in particular on <a1_0>the radar programme<a1_0/>. The last programme transmitted was a Mickey Mouse cartoon, <a2_0>Mickey's Gala Premier<a2_0/> (<b5_0>1933<b5_0/>), which was followed by test transmissions; this account refuted the popular memory according to which broadcasting was suspended <a3_0>before the end of the cartoon<a3_0/>.
